intro: Xylopicrum truncifolium, commonly known as the truncated-leaf xylopicrum, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its unique, truncate-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pale pink and white, which bloom during the early spring. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb moisture from the rocky soil in its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Xylopicrum truncifolium is considered a vulnerable species.
